timemanager

Class TM_Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • timemanager.TM_Timer

  • public class TM_Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    TM_Timer uses a Timeline as a counter, creating a keyframe per second that tick down the UI combobox values.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int hour 
      (package private) javafx.scene.control.ComboBox hoursCB 
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<javafx.animation.KeyFrame> keys 
      (package private) javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer mediaPlayer 
      (package private) javafx.scene.control.ComboBox minCB 
      (package private) int minute 
      (package private) javafx.scene.control.ComboBox secCB 
      (package private) int seconds 
      (package private) javafx.scene.control.Button startBtn 
      (package private) javafx.animation.Timeline timeline 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TM_Timer(javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer mediaPlayer, javafx.scene.control.Button startBtn, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox hoursCB, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox minCB, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox secCB, java.lang.String hour, java.lang.String minute, java.lang.String seconds) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void countDown()
      Count down the comboboxes, then play alarm when all are zero.
      private void setKeys(int seconds)
      Create a key per second to be used in the Timeline.
      void start()
      Create the Timeline, add the keys and then play the timeline.
      void stop()
      Stop the timeline, set reference to null to garbage collect the timeline object, as continue uses a whole new TM_Timer.
      private int timeToSeconds()
      Convert Hours, minutes and seconds passed in by user to just seconds.

    • Method Detail

      • timeToSeconds

        private int timeToSeconds()
        Convert Hours, minutes and seconds passed in by user to just seconds.
        Returns:
        seconds Integer value of total seconds

      • setKeys

        private void setKeys(int seconds)
        Create a key per second to be used in the Timeline. It's callback will tickdown the comboboxs. Store the keys in the array list keys.
        Parameters:
        seconds - Integer value of total seconds

      • start

        public void start()
        Create the Timeline, add the keys and then play the timeline.

      • countDown

        private void countDown()
        Count down the comboboxes, then play alarm when all are zero.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the timeline, set reference to null to garbage collect the timeline object, as continue uses a whole new TM_Timer.
